title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-11.2 - Manual or automatic-maximum firing rate up to seven gallons per hour
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-11.2 - Manual or automatic-maximum firing rate up to seven gallons per hour

State Regulations

On all manual or automatic oil-fired burners having a
firing rate up to seven gallons per hour, the main flame trial-for-ignition
period shall not exceed 90 seconds. Upon flame failure, the main oil valve
shall close automatically within 90 seconds. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-11.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
